sense.gloss: ceremony fitting child with a hakama
haori and hakama (Japanese male formal attire)
the shoemaker's children go barefoot, the dyer wears white, specialists often fail to apply their skills to themselves
betrothal money given from woman to man
ceremony of fitting child with a hakama
informal noh performed in light clothes (during the summer)

sdata.j: ↑紺屋↑↓こうや↓の↑白↑↓しろ↓↑袴↑↓ばかま↓。
↑紺屋↑↓こうや↓の↑白↑↓しろ↓↑袴↑↓ばかま↓。
トムね、↑成人↑↓せいじん↓↑式↑↓しき↓にめっちゃ↑派手↑↓はで↓な↑羽織↑↓はおり↓↑袴↑↓はかま↓で↑来↑↓き↓たんだよ。
sdata.e: Tom came to the coming-of-age ceremony in super flashy haori and hakama.

sdata.j: 「↑卒業↑↓そつぎょう↓↑式↑↓しき↓って、↑何↑↓なに↓↑着↑↓き↓る？↑振↑↓ふ↓り↑袖↑↓そで↓？↑袴↑↓はかま↓？スーツ？」「↑振↑↓ふ↓り↑袖↑↓そで↓とスーツは、↑卒業↑↓そつぎょう↓↑式↑↓しき↓じゃなくても↑着↑↓き↓れるから、↑袴↑↓はかま↓かな」
sdata.e: What will you wear for graduation ceremony? Long-sleeved kimono? Hakama? Suit? "Long-sleeved kimono and suit can be worn even if it's not a graduation ceremony, so maybe hakama."
